entry.title: SLB: short position stopped in and out
entry.summary:
I placed a short entry stop for SLB at 14:43 today for -0.20 trailing on the mark. The short triggered at 12:54 for \$50.56. But then at 15:45, exactly 15 minutes before the close, SLB and the market made a dash for the resistance. My exit stop was triggered at \$50.99.

Short entry: \$50.56

Stop: \$50.99

Target \$40

Reward / Risk = 10.56 / 0.43 = 25 > 5

My loss in this trade is about \$10 + \$10 for commission.

Even at the close, SLB (and the sector ETF, OIH) closed merely up 1% while the overall market jumped 2.4%. I took Tim Knight's suggestion on OIH, analyzed it, and then picked it apart by examining the underlying components of the oil services ETF. I found SLB to be particularly vulnerable and the reward/risk was good. So I placed the stop orders.

I might try again tomorrow.
